item.title: Beirut explosion: Anti-government protests break out in city
item.description: Lebanese security forces deployed tear gas on a group of demonstrators near parliament.

item.title: A-level and GCSE results: 'Improved' schools can challenge grades
item.description: The exam regulator adds greater rights of appeal amid concerns about unfair results in the pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus: Travellers from Belgium, Andorra, and the Bahamas must quarantine in UK
item.description: The changes start from 04:00 BST on Saturday except in Wales, where they start midnight Thursday.

item.title: Boy swept out to sea 'thought this was the end'
item.description: Ravi Saini, 10, survived for more than an hour at sea using advice he saw in a BBC TV documentary.

item.title: World's remotest Irish bar: 'We will survive Covid'
item.description: It has been closed since April, you can’t reach it by car, and it's a two-day hike from the nearest airport.

item.title: Christopher Steele: Ex-spy says more must be done to stop Russian interference
item.description: Christopher Steele, who compiled the Trump-Russia dossier, says all UK political parties are targets.

item.title: TikTok: Trump signs order to address 'threat' of Chinese app
item.description: Beginning in 45 days, any US transaction with parent company ByteDance will be banned.

item.title: School funding plan 'benefits wealthier pupils most'
item.description: The government's latest funding plan could "disproportionately benefit schools in better-off areas".

item.title: Anger rises as British Airways cuts start to bite
item.description: Cabin crew who are not made redundant on Friday will still face steep pay cuts.

item.title: US election 2020: Trump says opponent Biden will 'hurt God'
item.description: "He's against God. He's against guns," Mr Trump says of his Democratic challenger.

item.title: Leicester pub-goers warned ahead of reopening weekend
item.description: People in Leicester are free to enjoy themselves after the local lookdown but told be "responsible".

item.title: Chemotherapy in cancer patients with Covid-19 'not a risk'
item.description: Female breast cancer patients were much more likely to survive than other patients, a study says.

item.title: The Papers: France 'quarantine risk' and Flack mother's 'fury'
item.description: The front pages feature concern over cross-Channel travel and the Love Island presenter's inquest.

item.title: Coronavirus: How to stay cool in a face mask as hot UK weather forecast
item.description: Temperatures are forecast to top 30C in some parts of the UK this weekend. Perhaps it is not the time you want to be partially covering your face.

item.title: Beirut explosion: Before-and-after images
item.description: Satellite and aerial images show the extent of the Beirut port explosion that ripped through the Lebanese city.

item.title: Quiz of the week: What happened on FA Cup Final day?
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

item.title: How 'lockdown birdwatching' is helping Australia's bushfire recovery
item.description: Birdwatching has boomed during Australia's Covid-19 lockdown - and it's having an unexpected benefit.

item.title: Patrick Hutchinson: Viral 'hero' launches new project
item.description: Patrick Hutchinson was photographed carrying a counter-protester to safety at a London anti-racism rally in June.

item.title: Swimmer completes 13 Lake District lakes in three days
item.description: George Taplin swam 43 miles of Lake District waters over the course of the challenge.

item.title: TikTok swing challenge: Seven teens trapped in Derbyshire
item.description: Teenagers filming themselves in baby and toddler swings are warned not to waste fire crews' time.

item.title: Photographer captures swimming pools from above
item.description: Brad Walls photographs the beauty of sun-drenched swimming pools from an aerial view.

item.title: 'It took 32 years, but I finally found my kidnapped son'
item.description: After Li Jingzhi's son went missing in 1988 she dedicated her life to searching for him. He was found in May this year.

item.title: Why Nadia Rose put her 'finger up' to music bosses
item.description: The rapper on controlling her own destiny, "outlandish" new music, and receiving texts from Rihanna.

item.title: Hot weather: How to sleep in the heat
item.description: A simple guide on how to get a good night's sleep in the heat.

item.title: UK's winter athletes aim for a record Olympic medal haul
item.description: British winter sports boss Vicky Gosling explains why Team GB is aiming for a record Olympic medal haul.

item.title: The coldest computers in the world
item.description: New computers promise to cruise through old problems, but involve mind-boggling low temperatures.

item.title: Cosplay and Covid: Video gamers defy the virus
item.description: Video game meet-up ChinaJoy was one of the first big shows staged in China since the pandemic began.

item.title: How the pandemic is sending some Brazilians ‘two steps back’
item.description: Strides made to reduce poverty in Brazil are being reversed by the economic upheaval caused by Covid.

item.title: US election 2020 polls: Who is ahead - Trump or Biden?
item.description: An in-depth look at the polls and what they can and can’t tell us about who will win the White House.

item.title: Tashan Daniel: The Arsenal fan killed by a violent repeat offender
item.description: Tashan Daniel was on his way to an Arsenal game when he was stabbed by a man with a history of violence.

item.title: Hiroshima bomb: The day Michiko nearly missed her train
item.description: The horrors of the Hiroshima atomic bomb are laid bare through the story of one woman's life.

item.title: Beirut: Why has there been crisis after crisis in Lebanon?
item.description: From the war in 1975 to the explosion that devastated the port area of the capital, Beirut.

item.title: Coronavirus: The childcare 'jigsaw' parents are facing this summer
item.description: Many holiday clubs aren't running and some have had to hike up prices - how are parents coping?

item.title: Pakistan dominate woeful England - report & highlights
item.description: England are already facing defeat in the first Test after a Shan Masood-inspired Pakistan dominate the second day at Emirates Old Trafford.

item.title: Jimenez sends Wolves into first European quarter-final in 48 years
item.description: Wolverhampton Wanders beat Olympiakos 1-0 to secure a 2-1 aggregate win and reach the Europa League quarter-finals.

item.title: Woods makes solid start, Rose sits one off lead & DeChambeau breaks his driver
item.description: Tiger Woods shoots his lowest opening round in a major since 2012 after a two-under-par 68 at the US PGA Championship in San Francisco.

item.title: Higgins knocked out despite first Crucible 147 break since 2012 - video & report
item.description: Four-time champion John Higgins makes a maximum 147 break but cannot avoid a shock 13-11 defeat by Kurt Maflin in World Championship second round.

item.title: Bale 'didn't want to play' against Man City - Real boss Zidane
item.description: Real Madrid manager Zinedine Zidane says Gareth Bale "preferred not to play" in the Champions League last-16 second-leg tie against Manchester City.

item.title: Groenewegen apologises for Tour of Poland crash that left Jakobsen in coma
item.description: Dutch cyclist Dylan Groenewegen apologises for the crash that left compatriot Fabio Jakobsen in a coma.

item.title: Beirut explosion: How ship's deadly cargo ended up at port
item.description: More than 2,000 tons of ammonium nitrate arrived in 2013 on the Moldovan-flagged MV Rhosus.

item.title: Beirut explosion: What we know so far
item.description: A devastating explosion in Beirut on Tuesday killed at least 137 people and injured thousands.

item.title: Beirut: The bride being photographed in wedding dress as blast hit
item.description: Israa Seblani was posing for her wedding photographs when the huge explosion shook the nearby port area of Beirut.

item.title: Beirut explosion: Pianist's homage to the victims
item.description: Beirut resident May Melki says her rendition of Auld Lang Syne is a homage, not a farewell.

item.title: Why Lebanon was already in crisis
item.description: What has caused such anger across Lebanon - and why it is not going away.

item.title: Beirut explosion: Exploring the damage after the blast
item.description: A Beirut resident show how neighbours are trying to help clean up and recover after the blast.

item.title: In pictures: Chaos and destruction after the blast
item.description: Photos show the destruction in the Lebanese capital after a huge explosion.

item.title: Beirut explosion: What is ammonium nitrate and how dangerous is it?
item.description: Ammonium nitrate has been blamed for a deadly explosion in Beirut, but what exactly is the chemical?

item.title: How conspiracy theories spread after explosion
item.description: False rumours about what caused the Beirut explosion and who was behind it spread on social media.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the risks of opening schools?
item.description: Children seem to be at low risk from the disease, but can they still spread it?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the new lockdown rules for Aberdeen and other areas?
item.description: Scotland's first local lockdown has been declared in Aberdeen, but how is one imposed and what happens?

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Teams around the world are looking into medicines for Covid-19 and scientists are starting to discover what works.

item.title: Europe lockdown: New coronavirus curbs country by country
item.description: What are European countries doing to control new coronavirus outbreaks?

item.title: Coronavirus in the UK: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: How will schools reopen in September?
item.description: Schools are set to go back for the autumn term, but scientists say society may have to make trade-offs.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK travel quarantine rules?
item.description: What do you need to know if you're planning to fly during the Covid-19 pandemic?

item.title: Coronavirus: How does test-and-trace work?
item.description: People who have been in close contact with someone found to have Covid-19 are now being traced.

item.title: NBA: Black Lives Matter and basketball’s role in discussion on racism
item.description: Basketball is perhaps the sport best placed to challenge racial inequality. Is the NBA doing it right?
